detaileddescription.para:
Creates the object from the info passed
cameraMatrix
3x3 matrix (fx 0 cx, 0 fy cy, 0 0 1)
distorsionCoeff
4x1 matrix (k1,k2,p1,p2)
size
image size

Sets the parameters
cameraMatrix
3x3 matrix (fx 0 cx, 0 fy cy, 0 0 1)
distorsionCoeff
4x1 matrix (k1,k2,p1,p2)
size
image size
Indicates whether this object is valid
Reads from a YAML file generated with the OpenCV2.2 calibration utility
Adjust the parameters to the size of the image indicated

memberdef.argsstring: (cv::Size orgImgSize, cv::Size size, double proj_matrix[16], double gnear, double gfar, bool invert=false)
memberdef.name: glGetProjectionMatrix

detaileddescription.para: Given the intrinsic camera parameters returns the GL_PROJECTION matrix for OpenGL. Please NOTE that when using OpenGL, it is assumed no camera distortion! So, if it is not true, you should have undistorted image

parameterdescription.para: of the image/window where to render (can be different from the real camera image). Please not that it must be related to CamMatrix
output projection matrix to give to OpenGL
indicates if the output projection matrix has to yield a horizontally inverted image because image data has not been stored in the order of glDrawPixels: bottom-to-top.

memberdef.argsstring: (cv::Size orgImgSize, cv::Size size, double proj_matrix[16], double gnear, double gfar, bool invert=false)
memberdef.name: OgreGetProjectionMatrix

detaileddescription.para: Setup camera for an Ogre project. Use: ... Ogre::Matrix4 PM(proj_matrix[0], proj_matrix[1], ... , proj_matrix[15]); yourCamera->setCustomProjectionMatrix(true, PM); yourCamera->setCustomViewMatrix(true, Ogre::Matrix4::IDENTITY); ... As in OpenGL, it assumes no camera distortion
Returns the location of the camera in the reference system given by the rotation and translation vectors passed NOT TESTED
Returns the 4x4 homogeneous transform matrix from the R and T vectors computed

memberdef.argsstring: (double cparam[3][4], int width, int height, double gnear, double gfar, double m[16], bool invert)
